concept.display: Unable to express basic needs even with maximal prompting or assistance but is not comatose or unresponsive (for example, speech is nonsensical or unintelligible).
Responds only with reflex motor or autonomic effects or totally unresponsive, flaccid, and areflexic.
Completely limited - Unresponsive (does not flinch, grasp, moan, increase blood pressure, or heart rate) to painful stimuli due to diminished level of consciousness or sedation.
